channel.title: Crime Show
channel.description: Stories about people. And sometimes crime.

item.title: Behind the Locked Door
item.description: There is a locked door in Don Miller's basement museum. If anyone asks, he says it is just a storage closet. It is not just a storage closet.Read Josh Sanburn's article in Vanity Fair here. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Crime Is Born
item.description: Handcuffs, sting operations, and felony charges – welcome to the world of catching babies without a license. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Salon Bandit
item.description: It took years for Joe Watson to build the life he'd always dreamed of: a good career and a happy relationship. It took just months for him to tear it all down. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Coma and the Coffin
item.description: The story of Francesca's birth was something of family lore: a sudden death, an unexplained illness, and a casket crashing to the floor. But hiding in plain sight was an even stranger family story that no one wanted to talk about. Episode notes: To see more of Cynthia's research, click here. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The War in Jennifer Weiss
item.description: Inside Jennifer Weiss, a war has been brewing since she was four years old. But none of us would know about it were it not for this one choice she made three decades later. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 2021: The Stories That Got Away
item.description: Every Crime Show story starts with a pitch. But, for one reason or another, not every pitch turns into a Crime Show story. This week the whole team sits down with Emma to talk about their favorite pitches that never got made. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Scums.xls (with update)
item.description: *Rebroadcast of an episode we ran in April with an updated ending* After a man is threatened by a telephone scammer, he spends the next several years tracking down the person responsible. In the process, he uncovers a massive criminal syndicate operating in plain sight. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: An Unlikely Suspect
item.description: In 2012, a sleepy bedroom community experienced their first murder in almost 40 years. Police quickly figured out who committed the crime, but struggled to explain why he’d done it.Read Katie Worth's article for The Marshall Project here. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Ghost Story
item.description: At first, the house on Beryl Road seemed unremarkable -- just a typical suburban home in Northern Virginia. Then, a young couple moved in and started experiencing strange, ghostly phenomena.This episode mentions suicide. If you or someone you know is struggling with thoughts of suicide, free, confidential help is available 24/7 by calling the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Paging Dr. Barnes
item.description: There comes a time in everyone's life when you realize that your parents are two people: who they are with you, and who they are with the world. For Steve Barnes, that happened one day while he was reading the newspaper. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Don't Click This Link
item.description: One night, a 911 center in Olympia, Washington, was flooded with incoming calls. Something horrible had happened: there had been an attack. But the attack was on the center itself. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Man With No Name
item.description: A man wakes up at a shopping mall in Cincinnati, but claims to have no idea how he got there. He says he doesn’t even know his own name. As doctors and detectives search to uncover his identity, they discover an unexpected clue: The man’s amnesia may have been caused by a terrible attack. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The MySpace Misdemeanor
item.description: When teenager Hillary Transue made a MySpace page poking fun at her vice principal, she never imagined it would land her in a juvenile detention facility—and that to get out, she would need to expose a corruption scheme that ran to the highest echelons of the state's judicial system. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 21 Witnesses
item.description: In 1978, in Austin, Texas, something happened in Mr. Grayson’s eighth-grade English class that shocked the 21 students present, and reverberated forward into their adult lives. Forty years later they reunited to piece together what happened. Read Robert Draper’s Texas Monthly article here.Susie Davis, one of the students, wrote a book about this event that you can find here. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Takedown, pt.2
item.description: A helter skelter ride through London’s criminal underworld, blood-stained MMA gyms, an audacious bank robbery, and a manhunt that spanned continents. Part 2 of 2. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Takedown, pt.1
item.description: A helter skelter ride through London’s criminal underworld, blood-stained MMA gyms, an audacious bank robbery, and a manhunt that spanned continents. Part 1 of 2. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Secret Billboard Chart-Topper
item.description: Martha Wash was flipping through TV channels when, to her complete surprise, she happened upon a familiar voice: her own – coming out of the mouth of someone else. Problem was: stealing her voice wasn’t a crime. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Better Take Some Shovels, pt. 2
item.description: A social worker doesn’t hear from a client that she had placed at a boarding house. When she investigates, she discovers that her client isn’t the only one who is missing. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Better Take Some Shovels, pt. 1
item.description: A social worker doesn’t hear from a client that she had placed at a boarding house. When she investigates, she discovers that her client isn’t the only one who is missing. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: There's No Place Like Grand Rapids
item.description: A small town in Minnesota has an identity crisis: Should they embrace their beautiful lakes for tourism, or Judy Garland, the troubled movie star who was born there? When a big crime hits their small town, the decision is no longer theirs. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Scums.xls
item.description: After a man is threatened by a telephone scammer, he spends the next several years tracking down the person responsible. In the process, he uncovers a massive criminal syndicate operating in plain sight. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 18 Minutes
item.description: After a fire blazes through her home and kills her baby, a mother struggles to pick up the pieces of her life. Six years later, investigators show up with some shocking news. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: This is Not a Crime Show
item.description: The stories are true and the topic is crime. But it's really about people — the survivors, victims, perpetrators — in their own words, telling the stories of a crime, and the unexpected impact it’s had on their lives. Launches March 23rd. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
